mrgsolve
  • Reference
  • News

Methods for working with the model compartment list.

Calling init with the model object as the first argument will return the model initial conditions as a numericlist object. See numericlist for methods to deal with cmt_list objects.

init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for mrgmod
init(.x, .y = list(), ..., .pat = "*")

# S4 method for mrgsims
init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for missing
init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for list
init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for ANY
init(.x, ...)

as.init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for list
as.init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for numeric
as.init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for cmt_list
as.init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for missing
as.init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for `NULL`
as.init(.x, ...)

# S4 method for cmt_list
show(object)

Arguments

.x
the model object
...
passsed along
.y
list to be merged into parameter list
.pat
a regular expression (character) to be applied as a filter when printing compartments to the screen
object
to show

Value

an object of class cmt_list (see numericlist)

Details

Can be used to either get a compartment list object from a mrgmod model object or to update the compartment initial conditions in a model object. For both uses, the return value is a cmt_list object. For the former use, init is usually called to print the compartment initial conditions to the screen, but the cmt_list object can also be coreced to a list or numeric R object.

Examples

## example("init")
mod <- mrgsolve:::house()

init(mod)
init(mod, .pat="^C") ## may be useful for large models

class(init(mod))

init(mod)$CENT

as.list(init(mod))
as.data.frame(init(mod))

Contents
